trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> samples demonstrate key <token>sb2</token> (cloud service) and <token>sb_onprem</token> features.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> samples demonstrate key <token>sb2</token> (cloud service) and <token>sb_onprem</token> features.

trans-unit.source: To download the samples, visit <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK samples page</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=230972</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To download the samples, visit <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK samples page</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=230972</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This topic categorizes and describes the samples available, with links to each.
trans-unit.target: This topic categorizes and describes the samples available, with links to each.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> samples are not installed with the SDK.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> samples are not installed with the SDK.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the samples, visit the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK samples page</linkText><linkUri>https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/site/search?query=service%20bus%%amp;amp;f%5B0%5D.Value=service%20bus%%amp;amp;f%5B0%5D.Type=SearchText%%amp;amp;ac=2</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the samples, visit the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK samples page</linkText><linkUri>https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/site/search?query=service%20bus%%amp;amp;f%5B0%5D.Value=service%20bus%%amp;amp;f%5B0%5D.Type=SearchText%%amp;amp;ac=2</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following samples illustrate how to write applications that use <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following samples illustrate how to write applications that use <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the brokered messaging samples require a connection string to access your <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note that the brokered messaging samples require a connection string to access your <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>.

trans-unit.source: To obtain a connection string for Azure Service Bus
trans-unit.target: To obtain a connection string for Azure Service Bus

trans-unit.source: In the left-hand column, click <ui>Service Bus</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the left-hand column, click <ui>Service Bus</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of your <token>servicensd</token> in the list.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of your <token>servicensd</token> in the list.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Access connection information</ui> dialog, copy the connection string to your clipboard.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Access connection information</ui> dialog, copy the connection string to your clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Paste the connection string into the App.config file for the sample.
trans-unit.target: Paste the connection string into the App.config file for the sample.

trans-unit.source: To obtain a connection string for Service Bus for Windows Server
trans-unit.target: To obtain a connection string for Service Bus for Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Paste the connection string into the App.config file for the sample.
trans-unit.target: Paste the connection string into the App.config file for the sample.

trans-unit.source: These samples describe basic messaging and relay functionality.
trans-unit.target: These samples describe basic messaging and relay functionality.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages from a queue.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages from a queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages from a topic with multiple subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages from a topic with multiple subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates the basic capabilities of Event Hubs, such as creating an Event Hub, sending events to an Event hub, consuming events using the Event Processor.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates the basic capabilities of Event Hubs, such as creating an Event Hub, sending events to an Event hub, consuming events using the Event Processor.

trans-unit.source: The following samples demonstrate various features of <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following samples demonstrate various features of <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates the different ways of authenticating an HTTP/REST client with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates the different ways of authenticating an HTTP/REST client with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to send messages to and receive messages from <token>sb2</token> via HTTP/REST.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to send messages to and receive messages from <token>sb2</token> via HTTP/REST.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to automatically forward messages from a queue, subscription, or deadletter queue into another queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to automatically forward messages from a queue, subscription, or deadletter queue into another queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: It also demonstrates how to send a message into a queue or topic via a transfer queue.
trans-unit.target: It also demonstrates how to send a message into a queue or topic via a transfer queue.

trans-unit.source: Brokered Messaging: WCF Channel Session Sample
trans-unit.target: Brokered Messaging: WCF Channel Session Sample

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> using <token>indigo1</token> channels.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> using <token>indigo1</token> channels.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows the use of <token>indigo2</token> channels to send and receive messages via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows the use of <token>indigo2</token> channels to send and receive messages via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows both session and non-session communication over the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows both session and non-session communication over the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> messaging features within a transaction scope in order to ensure batches of messaging operations are committed atomically.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> messaging features within a transaction scope in order to ensure batches of messaging operations are committed atomically.

trans-unit.source: Brokered Messaging: Management Operations Using REST
trans-unit.target: Brokered Messaging: Management Operations Using REST

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to perform management operations on <token>sb2</token> using REST.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to perform management operations on <token>sb2</token> using REST.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the new <token>sb2</token> RDFE REST APIs to manage namespaces and messaging entities.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the new <token>sb2</token> RDFE REST APIs to manage namespaces and messaging entities.

trans-unit.source: Brokered Messaging: WCF Service Session Sample
trans-unit.target: Brokered Messaging: WCF Service Session Sample

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> using the <token>indigo2</token> service model.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> using the <token>indigo2</token> service model.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows the use of the <token>indigo2</token> service model to accomplish session-based communication via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows the use of the <token>indigo2</token> service model to accomplish session-based communication via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> and the request/response functionality.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> and the request/response functionality.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the messaging "dead letter queue" functionality.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the messaging "dead letter queue" functionality.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows a simple sender and receiver communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows a simple sender and receiver communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the message deferral feature of <token>sb1</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the message deferral feature of <token>sb1</token>.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows a simple sender and receiver communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows a simple sender and receiver communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the Messaging Session functionality.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the Messaging Session functionality.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows simple senders and receivers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows simple senders and receivers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to implement the request/response pattern using <token>sb1</token> topics and subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to implement the request/response pattern using <token>sb1</token> topics and subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> topic.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via a <token>sb2</token> topic.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the request/response functionality.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> and the request/response functionality.

trans-unit.source: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via two <token>sb2</token> queues.
trans-unit.target: The sample shows simple clients and servers communicating via two <token>sb2</token> queues.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> duplicate message detection with queues.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> duplicate message detection with queues.

trans-unit.source: It creates two queues, one with duplicate detection enabled and other one without duplicate detection.
trans-unit.target: It creates two queues, one with duplicate detection enabled and other one without duplicate detection.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages asynchronously from a queue.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to send and receive messages asynchronously from a queue.

trans-unit.source: The queue provides decoupled, asynchronous communication between a sender and any number of receivers (here, a single receiver).
trans-unit.target: The queue provides decoupled, asynchronous communication between a sender and any number of receivers (here, a single receiver).

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> publish/subscribe advanced filters.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> publish/subscribe advanced filters.

trans-unit.source: It creates a topic and 3 subscriptions with different filter definitions, sends messages to the topic, and receives all messages from subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: It creates a topic and 3 subscriptions with different filter definitions, sends messages to the topic, and receives all messages from subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> messages prefetch feature.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <token>sb1</token> messages prefetch feature.

trans-unit.source: It demonstrates how to use the messages prefetch feature upon receive.
trans-unit.target: It demonstrates how to use the messages prefetch feature upon receive.

trans-unit.source: Samples that demonstrate the Service Bus relay.
trans-unit.target: Samples that demonstrate the Service Bus relay.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to run a <token>sb1</token> client and service on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to run a <token>sb1</token> client and service on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: Only environment and security information is stored in the configuration files.
trans-unit.target: Only environment and security information is stored in the configuration files.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use an issuer name and issuer secret to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use an issuer name and issuer secret to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to expose an HTTP service that does not require client user authentication.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to expose an HTTP service that does not require client user authentication.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>WebHttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding to return binary data using the Web programming model.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>WebHttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding to return binary data using the Web programming model.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding.

trans-unit.source: Samples that demonstrate the Service Bus relay.
trans-unit.target: Samples that demonstrate the Service Bus relay.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use a simple web token credential to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use a simple web token credential to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The sample is similar to the Echo sample, with a few changes.
trans-unit.target: The sample is similar to the Echo sample, with a few changes.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, this sample adds a behavior in the ServiceHost (service) and ChannelFactory (client) applications.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, this sample adds a behavior in the ServiceHost (service) and ChannelFactory (client) applications.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to route messages to multiple receivers.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use <token>sb1</token> to route messages to multiple receivers.

trans-unit.source: It shows multiple instances of a simple service communicating with a client via the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding
trans-unit.target: It shows multiple instances of a simple service communicating with a client via the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates using the <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with reliable sessions enabled.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates using the <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with reliable sessions enabled.

trans-unit.source: It also shows how to specify <token>sb2</token> credentials in the configuration file instead of programmatically.
trans-unit.target: It also shows how to specify <token>sb2</token> credentials in the configuration file instead of programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with message security to secure end-to-end messages while still requiring clients to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with message security to secure end-to-end messages while still requiring clients to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to expose a metadata endpoint that uses the relay binding.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to expose a metadata endpoint that uses the relay binding.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>MetadataExchange</embeddedLabel> is supported in the following relay bindings: <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>NetOnewayRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>BasicHttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>MetadataExchange</embeddedLabel> is supported in the following relay bindings: <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>NetOnewayRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>BasicHttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>WS2007HttpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to configure the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding to support the <embeddedLabel>Hybrid</embeddedLabel> connection mode which first establishes a relayed connection, and if possible, switches automatically to a direct connection between a client and a service.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to configure the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding to support the <embeddedLabel>Hybrid</embeddedLabel> connection mode which first establishes a relayed connection, and if possible, switches automatically to a direct connection between a client and a service.

trans-unit.source: Relayed Messaging Bindings: NetTcp MsgSec UserName
trans-unit.target: Relayed Messaging Bindings: NetTcp MsgSec UserName

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with message security.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to use the <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding with message security.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to expose and consume a service endpoint using the <languageKeyword>NetOnewayRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to expose and consume a service endpoint using the <languageKeyword>NetOnewayRelayBinding</languageKeyword> binding.

trans-unit.source: It demonstrates a simple service that uses no security options and does not require clients to authenticate.
trans-unit.target: It demonstrates a simple service that uses no security options and does not require clients to authenticate.

trans-unit.source: The following samples demonstrate various other features of the service.
trans-unit.target: The following samples demonstrate various other features of the service.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> Explorer allows users to connect to a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> and manage messaging entities in an easy manner.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> Explorer allows users to connect to a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> and manage messaging entities in an easy manner.

trans-unit.source: The tool provides advanced features such as import/export functionality, and the ability to test messaging entities and relay services.
trans-unit.target: The tool provides advanced features such as import/export functionality, and the ability to test messaging entities and relay services.

trans-unit.source: This sample demonstrates how to create and manage service identities in <token>firstref_acs</token> for use with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This sample demonstrates how to create and manage service identities in <token>firstref_acs</token> for use with <token>sb2</token>.
